channel.title: Need help putting server online Eclipse (pictures showing how I set it all up)
channel.description:
I am new to coding and I am trying to run epicurus through eclipse. But every time I start the source. This pops up.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/ZomyNlt.png[/img]
[b]And this is how I setted the server up through eclipse.[/b]
[b]Server Folder:[/b]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/7ZmFWQp.png[/img]
[b]Created new java project:[/b]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/XAPOJub.png[/img]
[b]Then I went to run configurations and selected these options:[/b]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/MY26Min.png[/img]
[b]Here are where it is saying the errors are:[/b]
[b]Serverpanel.java, 282:[/b]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/G4sxXNp.png[/img]
[b]
Playerhandler.java, 19, 29[/b]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/rZivrHn.png[/img]
Then I tried to run It by pressing the green run/start button at the top. Then it still gives me that error. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

item.title: Need help putting server online Eclipse (pictures showing how I set it all up)
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“popcorn57, post:6, topic:552671”][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=671587.msg4491296#msg4491296 date=1438193777]
why would you even want to run a production server in eclipse?
[/quote]

Only because there is no compiler in the original source. And I tried a few but none of them worked so people pointed me to eclipse. If I could find a good working compiler I would much prefer that!

Check your config for what the variable “MAX_PLAYERS” is set to.
It seems that’s a negative value, thus setting the players array to a negative, creating your error seen in the console.

Thanks for the reply Sk8r I did switch it, and it got rid of all of those errors thank you! But now it is just saying “failure starting up world” in the console[/quote]
Believe me you’d be much better off with Eclipse… It seems a bit complex at first, but once you really get into it… It’s there absolute best!

Read full topic
item.source: Need help putting server online Eclipse (pictures showing how I set it all up)

item.title: Need help putting server online Eclipse (pictures showing how I set it all up)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

trace the message back to it’s origin and see why it’s printing it.
that’s not a java error message, that’s a user defined one, so it should be in the code.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help putting server online Eclipse (pictures showing how I set it all up)
item.dc:creator: @popcorn57 popcorn57
item.description:
@popcorn57 wrote:

Justin Bieber:

why would you even want to run a production server in eclipse?

Only because there is no compiler in the original source. And I tried a few but none of them worked so people pointed me to eclipse. If I could find a good working compiler I would much prefer that!

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:552671”]Check your config for what the variable “MAX_PLAYERS” is set to.
It seems that’s a negative value, thus setting the players array to a negative, creating your error seen in the console.[/quote]

Thanks for the reply Sk8r I did switch it, and it got rid of all of those errors thank you! But now it is just saying “failure starting up world” in the console
